02B67DAE53424B6193E43F9A1427E375.description: Investigate ways to apply visual art skills to careers that are seemingly unrelated to the arts.

BD8AB218B66B43929982532458CC92BB.description: Create artist social media presence or website including posts of process, progress and final products.

F6AA23B4AF52455BAF6523BBAFF00580.description: Create materials to market one’s skills (e.g., compose a résumé and artist statement).

169A12D1DD2C4CF9829E5691074AA35A.description: Evaluate the financial and other supports (e.g., grants, exhibition space, marketing, community members) available to practicing artists.

E504EED334EA46419DE030A87D51B9A0.description: Demonstrate agency and independence as an emerging artist by maintaining physical studio spaces that are safe and utilizing resources appropriately considering practices that respect the environment and minimize impact.

6604F0F2C96C48BA9BD5DECFC8E9E9A2.description: Examine criteria used to determine the sale value of art and estimate the sale value of own artwork.

819BAB7E4E314F199A260193E7B93E3A.description: Demonstrate awareness of post-secondary study in the arts and local and global career opportunities.

6887C94F971E4484A9E87C8AC89DE247.description: Explore and develop skills for pursuing a career in the arts within a work study, apprenticeship or mentorship experience (e.g., local artists, First Nations and Métis artists).

B4BBA4647B7D41E3B11F58479509217C.description: Expand entrepreneurship skills by studying art as a business (e.g., copyright, insurance, income tax, art contracts, art dealers, and art suppliers).

C3400E0F9BDE447AB5D7203E8826FA7E.description: Activate self-advocacy and agency as an emerging artist by connecting with arts professionals, including First Nations and Métis.

DD19796DC4224F4D83CCD5AFD1EBB438.description: Discuss aesthetic knowledge in art and principles of universal beauty (e.g., golden ratio).

D2D8D4E8C0ED4731805826B1165FA802.description: Reflect and identify how the production and consumption of artistic knowledge can positively impact health and well-being.

9366407B42E34A75B23D24BDFA06B7E5.description: Examine art as a social critique and means of promoting global understanding.

C2CAA3B4ECA04D38A1968CC55B7F74E8.description: Investigate examples of interdisciplinary work involving arts and non-arts fields.

F1B5AD156FB542BE83E2184D67F2AD47.description: Analyze methodologies used by artists as researchers and apply to own inquiry.

67231BB7D84B482EB9F1456A2FD3FE03.description: Investigate how art that persuades and/or protests is used to affect beliefs (e.g., propaganda, advertising, film, folk art).

75D9FC0652704D0BBCEAB994596ED09C.description: Examine how art uses non-verbal visual language to embed knowledge (e.g., traditional First and Métis ways of knowing, world cultures, historical artifacts) and apply to own work.

B9EAD7CE82AC478EB30181F5DEF57B35.description: Study cultural and historical themes in art (e.g., equality, politics, family, poverty, gender) to learn how artists contextualize or re-contextualize content.

B0AB689C32A2480987A32FCEC259F090.description: Explore inventive contemporary art (e.g., maker and hacker cultures, game design, video culture, interactive art, land art) to formulate personal definition of art and understand its purposes.

2F4A4BA5E9E14062B67310530B139783.description: Appraise current trends and emerging practices to determine how artists produce and embed knowledge within work.

4A4733AEB2624BBD80B086BA9DF2BF2E.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

E91B95C8D9F54843AFAC8DFDA2E87FD5.description: Compose a presentation portfolio (e.g., select items from one’s working portfolio) to best showcase one’s strengths and development as an artist.

962C3BA7D6DB4649B5AFFEB7E8D0F675.description: Explain how own work is situated in current culture and reflects own views.

AC659AC949B14FC6B55A968E81DAD1B2.description: Assess and apply select feedback from trusted sources to improve or fully resolve own work.

2EA9C29F4F874B98A6F71F05D517EDB5.description: Conduct portfolio review identifying areas of strength and areas for growth that guide goals for improvement.

AEDCF79712A34E0C9DBB58976659781D.description: Identify own influences, intentions and processes in the creation of non-derivative works and development of personal aesthetic vision.

F14A2796E8304D9288A414F96360DBED.description: Refer to documentation of initial ideas and explain how intentions may have evolved through creative process.

66DA29590F864DAE966F4EFA24AC75B8.description: Explain how inquiry and research inform inception of own work.

7EA342632BFA4E32A5C55C2FAE82247F.description: Use a variety of formal and informal art appreciation approaches to guide feedback.

B6911C651FD34379A1560976A3ED7A50.description: Collectively choose criteria for reviewing student art including how to determine if work is complete rather than abandoned.

FED899FE11F64212A7EC3DFE203CF12F.description: Critique works in progress and portfolio development with peers and other experienced reviewers to inform the development of that work and/or lead future work.

4EF823624CF4408F98F949AA2A7CF388.description: Make connections to work studied and own creations.

DD995E8CC07741EE82186CC16A26C66E.description: Select works to investigate from applied and commercial disciplines including traditional and emerging technologies and practices.

09FDA6FCFD3F456FAD8F8F4F38AB84BF.description: Study works to determine how artists conceptualize and communicate ideas and apply to own work.

8408CDA2D4994D1EB0753B24F272B983.description: Assess the effect of viewing and deconstructing art on own perspectives, perceptions and biases.

490419BCD2FC4706AAC982905C755912.description: Identify cultural, political, historical or spiritual factors affecting the work of several artists across disciplines or time periods.

F3EBBBE5E2DA4CB1BBAFD6D78FA9C4E4.description: Deconstruct visual content within a range of works, created for a variety of purposes, to acquire lessons that can be applied to own work.

5E0D2E4B226D419BB2293C3A73455D2F.description: Reflect on the role of audience, critic and consumer by researching initial reactions of critics at the time selected work was produced and the response of the audience of the day in contrast to today’s audience.

E5CBC61070544370AAB286E5A7B9211B.description: Investigate how perspectives of diverse cultural groups, including Black, First Nations, Métis, and people of colour, are represented in their art forms.

234587BD80C240BCB281AF721B8611AA.description: Utilize recognized critical analysis processes in addition to informal and personal approaches to examine how art reflects on and contributes to culture and society.

2BE969C967F045DC876C1D296D5E7E2D.description: Compare/contrast the function and social impact of selected works that explore similar topics.

78E3969A1CBA4745940457C2E3CDEE0F.description: Utilize creative and systematic investigations to critically analyze, interpret and respond to professional art, orally and in writing, across formats, styles, cultures and time periods.

5547E9DCC9BA41C8BEE83EF09FB7D640.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

CBCB8F3B23C34F8B8EECB73A2DEA1EC3.description: Document exhibition with camera and ensure that digital images accurately represent the original works on display and format of the overall design of show.

EE78133A3E7E4B50B6449A0AC57362FC.description: Identify and apply gallery conventions of mounting an exhibition such as signing works, matting works, framing works, selecting lighting, designing invitations and catalogues, writing an artist statement, handling and display of art pieces, use of signage, traffic flow patterns, promotion, disassembly and follow-up.

CE58CD43000F48CCA9FCD4106F3EE323.description: Plan and develop one or more projects that showcase artwork with the local, school or online community.

D365E366ED564C9A89EA0533483B4259.description: Engage in critical decision making to select and prepare own works for public display.

09CD691840A4464682F58E76938B7268.description: Identify the elements of a marketing strategy that are likely to generate interest in a student art exhibition

7B020BD6929D438E912FA8FA83248D81.description: Consider how the public is involved in the exhibition and ways that artists engage viewers to reflect and respond to work.

32C29D00E9DC4764B7805488030BB8B9.description: View various visual art exhibits in locations such as galleries, land-based environments, popups and community centres, to analyze and discuss how the curated show tells a story

F6B04795448B4B3C8DBB9D131F132DD6.description: Describe a range of methods of, and purposes for, presenting art to the public.

9EC0404AA1154F789462705F3FEF0678.description: Discuss how contemporary curatorial work has evolved to include historically-excluded worldviews such as Indigenous, feminist and minorities

2DD95DC3F6014734BA1D8FF98DEF3277.description: Collaboratively research the changing role of the curator in diverse and inclusive institutions and communities.

EFA2A7C10EBD476CAC1DBEEFEAAA4E26.description: Prepare and curate an exhibition of own work in a professional and collaborative manner.

816DDC04B8F64F3B9B9C672106942771.description: Research the philosophy of aesthetics and assess own work for the application of these principles.

388765C122B04555B6C98FFF7D098837.description: Apply critical and creative thinking to define ways to work within and push the boundaries of artistic conventions.

40937C110CE04990838FABA03EF81114.description: Demonstrate a unique, personal voice while extending art works beyond common artistic clichés or exercises.

8646F209239940B4AFF1F59835A407CD.description: Evaluate and make revisions to existing works to employ innovative or imaginative visual arrangements.

2442333A927640D8AF34279B3ABDBC70.description: Use synectics as a tool to develop creative thinking strategies.

BA197F7BB4E64A83910437E00E4921EB.description: Take risks with elements of art, principles of design, and composition/design rules to work beyond the confines of those theories and increase visual impact.

0557FFF08AEA48B5A8DC93EA7B7F137F.description: Accentuate personal style and voice when applying image development strategies.

F1B8D3CB72444EA4B7BDAC97C829453C.description: Use compositional and design strategies in a variety of ways to convey meaning and create visual interest.

9E046B5E32F648FB94CEC98B357D8354.description: Cultivate proficiency in manipulating visual, stylistic and conceptual conventions to solve a range of challenging art making investigations.

D2731D7980314778B170D89ACEC07469.description: Edit, during post-production, digital images of own work to aid in presenting the clearest, most accurate representation of the work and ensure that images meet the requirements of selected digital submission web application.

36F383DAD0C74363AA368C90D08AD761.description: Prepare for portfolio submission by creating high quality, well composed, high resolution photographs of completed works.

ABD93AF6D499468E8B76F1E268B78E05.description: Evaluate current portfolio and/or sketchbook to assess strengths that can be built on and incorporated into future works.

EA281F13C5994E36A1794BCD34677316.description: Demonstrate evidence of regular exploration and independent thinking through ongoing studio work.

DBE83DA407BB4B6BB6C36D841D6D1346.description: Actively record own practice, experimentation and revision of works up to and including final versions demonstrating, for example: preliminary rough drafts, written reflections, artist study, reasoning and motivations during process, risk-taking with mixed media, layering and current techniques for creating visual interest and nuanced meaning, critical responses to contemporary conceptual approaches in art making, analysis of strengths and weaknesses of own creative process, how feedback has been applied to elevate works included in presentation portfolio and documentation of selected aspects of own process through photographs.

16CCE02F2B464666835E04F009ABC3D0.description: Describe and experiment with the fluid, cyclical nature of the creative process

49DA71121E45486D9D5F3751F641E6B8.description: Critically analyze and compare own creative process to methods used by practicing artists in order to incorporate relevant aspects to own practice.

46625012407F4E0D8621E4408B0B23C8.description: Connect with artists who create work for a variety of purposes to inquire about creative process.

DEAEA184A9AA4EF08E388AFF6DCAF883.description: Refine and document full range of own creative process (e.g., idea generation, sketches, drafts, maquettes, reference work, source material, research, production, media exploration, critique, refinement) including completed works, providing evidence of critical inquiry.

D1FA1D113593415487D56A1DFEB960AE.description: Respond knowledgeably and sensitively to the work of others with inventive interpretations to merge and mold to own style and message.

F5ABBE5D679E41859FD6675995B4AA55.description: Create through multiple lenses, design strategies and perspectives to apply new ways of communicating own views.

3792F0849F754ECFBA859C1019741468.description: Research plagiarism policies of universities, colleges, art schools and art programs.

0489C17F4E5940429BF132ACB6B22D13.description: Provide rationale for historical, cultural and stylistic references in own work and describe how personal experiences, interests and intentions are depicted in portfolio.

78690B3698C64E8F90AC7C4455A64A15.description: Discuss the concepts of ethics, authenticity and originality along with community norms and values related to art production and marketing, including online, in the context of contemporary art practices.

AA0F78643B8548A7B394DFF4E70F4076.description: Research legal and ethical concerns in the context of intellectual, virtual and physical property influencing own work particularly when similarities to the work of others is intended.

0A3C49899595481C84E7423131A07ED4.description: Alter significantly several aspects of own work when referencing photographic, illustrative or other work that belongs to another artist using methods such as: improvising a mashup of three works while exploring an idea of personal significance and referring to an inspiration file and sketchbook to alter and combine ideas in new ways.

FC347D2A8F44454D9F5312FB04A610B8.description: Evaluate own portfolio for instances of copying and revise derivative works by interpreting, stylizing, layering or abstracting to communicate own ideas in new ways.

9A52651B21F6479389CB6CD5F1B5A636.description: Experiment with mashups, collages or mixed media works that demonstrate appropriately placing own work ‘in conversation’ with another artist or style.

426FC6D2156B4D49B930AA1E7F64B478.description: Examine works of various personal, social, cultural and historical contexts recording inspirational aspects, visually or in writing, and define intentions for responding artistically to this work.

9F9525208C5145268CB9DB15D3B5BCD8.description: Create original works inspired by artists of personal interest while maintaining own intentions and artistic vision.

2E3148CCBB064976865B4F53BAB920D1.description: Research interdisciplinary connections along with cultural and historical examples, including Indigenous, that expand on selected investigation to determine how other disciplines or cultures might respond to same inquiry.

F69FB3FB7B58428B9744B9AFB7AAAFEA.description: Evaluate and critique own art works, with input from peers and teacher, at various stages for technical success and relationship to selected inquiry.

5DB57D3A5DF04DEDA80B46BEC06B3357.description: Exercise creative voice and critical decision making to convey an informed perspective and real-world application of selected inquiry.

84B7D174FED048739C242C00DE7BE8E1.description: Articulate a clear planning, research, production and reflection process to develop a portfolio of work shaped through inquiry and the possibility of real-world applications.

320497F553B5472D9B7938ABAA438FC7.description: Connect with artists, including Indigenous, to learn how they speculate, hypothesize, research, test, discover and experiment throughout their career.

3640EF10694A4046A9DC4EB505A6BE89.description: Strive for increasingly sophisticated and/or sensitive works that build on existing strengths while challenging current level of technical proficiency.

045720F00B3748979190E51F0FBA999B.description: Plan and create works demonstrating personal artistic voice from direct observation, dreams, fantasies, inspirations, combinations of found references and own photographic compositions and designs.

DE98AC396BBE433B9F366E9DDC304EF6.description: Generate inquiry questions to guide own investigations

0EF2AE29B77B4359AB1864BE18C1BA8B.description: Brainstorm big ideas for sustained investigation drawing on experiences, interests, visual culture and/or contemporary issues.

78038D7BD69D4D16B04ACEB765ABD70B.description: Research, plan, produce, analyze and resolve a series of works exploring, through independent inquiry, big ideas of personal significance.

8601699D739F474EBBD57F8B12C48443.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
